@metoffice @EnvAgencyMids The @EnvAgencyMids are urging people to stay away from the area. This picture from @DaveThroupEA shows the extent of damage that some residents are having to deal with #HeartNews https://t.co/in7rOLFvWc

üîä #Incident #Update üîä

@EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam have installed 3 Ultra High Volume Pumps at #Wistow near #Selby. (Started last night and finished up this morning).

These pumps shift over 1 tonne of water a second!

These pumps are reducing the #flood levels in the village. https://t.co/zAc6fvYp0h

Brilliant example by @EnvAgencyYNE of using a tidal defence asset to exclude the tide to make room for incoming fluvial water reducing upstream river flooding.

This clever thinking shows how to make the most out of existing FCRM assets & perhaps better justify new ones. üìèüìêüåä https://t.co/cAbA0wufEc
@EnvAgencyYNE @OHDB_ @MyDoncaster Thanks for the mention. Our team at Danvm Drainage Commissioners (IDB) very happy to assist. OHDB, Danvm and 6 other IDBs now work together as @IDBYorkshire

Our Hydrometry & Telemetry team are out again this morning taking river flow measurements on the River Severn. These measurements help to calibrate information taken by our monitoring stations https://t.co/TxAv36TjZG
Wow! Striking picture of v high water levels being held back by the superb @EnvAgencyMids demountable #flood defences. üëèüëèüëè https://t.co/43s9AquMv0

We have deployed a number of pumps in and around Malton and Norton to protect the community from flooding, working with @RyedaleDC @northyorkscc & @YorkshireWater to mange and alleviate flooding. Stay #floodaware https://t.co/4duBrDlDPe

tweets.text: As river levels start to drop we've removed #floodwarnings for #RiverSwale at Helperby & Thornton Bridge & the #floodalert for #RiverWiske. A flood alert remains in place on #RiverSwale. There are 18 #floodwarnings across Yorkshire & we continue to monitor levels. https://t.co/fy5yYvvrYW
Environment Agency High Volume Pumps continue to pump flood water out of the #Fishlake Woodhouse Washland to reduce levels alongside the @OHDB_ pumping station https://t.co/V24nmaO43A

We have closed the Hull Tidal Surge Barrier tonight at low tide to help reduce water levels in the #RiverHull. The 212 tonne steel gate will prevent tidal water entering the River Hull, creating additional space to drain river water. https://t.co/sPqrXyqZ6r

The following pictures show our @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam installing the #uHVP‚Äôs overnight.

These snippets show the scale of the logistical work that goes on (often out of sight) keeping communities safe and responding to #incidents https://t.co/pWMin0XsOT

We use ultra high volume pumps #uHVP to help keep communities safe. Here‚Äôs @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam installing three in a night time operation. The amount of water to move when there‚Äôs risk of #flooding is huge. These pumps can shift 1 tonne of water every second. https://t.co/aKPiCwvc7j

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork And the River Ure at Boroughbridge is still very high, and turns into the River Ouse at York.

Some more views on the impact of HS2 tunnelling on the chalk aquifer. The @EnvAgency have been good at setting poor targets and their skills at sweeping problems under the carpet are beyond compare. https://t.co/TwtS8yViJP

River levels on the #RiverDerwent remain high and we have #floodwarnings in place in #Malton and #Norton. We‚Äôre working with partners @RyedaleDC @NorthYorksCC @NorthYorksFire using pumps to reduce #flood risk to local homes and businesses. Stay up to date: https://t.co/h4ufUzQwK2 https://t.co/ZEPqMUnbGX
